Class GameLoaderTest

java.lang.Object
GameLoaderTest
class GameLoaderTest extends Object
This might be overkill, but I want there to be tests for EVERYTHING. This is as much modeling good behaviour as anything. This class exists to run Hangman. Also, as a source for some hints...

  • Field Details

    • loader

      GameLoader loader
      Create memory space for our GameLoader object and a global variable. It is initialized elsewhere.

    • testFile

      private static final String testFile
      Our main test file. It is created and deleted by this class.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • singleWord

      private static final String singleWord
      Another test file with a single word.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • oneWord

      private static final String oneWord
      The single word we are testing.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • originalSystemIn

      private InputStream originalSystemIn
      This is tricky. We are saving Standard.in, so we can replace it and fake keyboard input. Neat!

    • testInput

      private ByteArrayInputStream testInput
      This is the input Stream that will fake keyboard input.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameLoaderTest

      GameLoaderTest()

  • Method Details

    • makeTheFile

      @BeforeAll static void makeTheFile()
      @BeforeAll runs before everything else. THis is where the test files are created.

    • removeFile

      @AfterAll static void removeFile()
      Runs after everything else. Deletes the test files.

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach void setUp()
      Runs before each test. This is where we preserve System.in.

    • tearDown

      @AfterEach void tearDown()
      Runs after each test. This is where we restore System.in. We could probably only do this ONCE but still.

    • fileCreated

      @Test void fileCreated()
      Just what it says on the tin. Create a file and make sure it can be Scanned.

    • gameLoaderTest

      @Test void gameLoaderTest()
      I feel really proud of this. Use a ByteArrayInputStream to fake user input. Should open a game and exit.

    • gameWinTest

      @Test void gameWinTest()
      same as gameLoaderTest() but testing win condition.
